intro: Daiswa forrestii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. It typically grows in open grasslands and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Daiswa forrestii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
